emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of autonomously developing software, from design to deployment, significantly reducing human involvement in coding.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Redefines the role of software developers, potentially leading to job displacement or evolution of developer roles, and raises ethical questions about AI authorship and accountability.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial investment in AI infrastructure, regulatory acceptance, and need for robust security measures to prevent AI-generated vulnerabilities.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Integration of post-quantum cryptographic algorithms into blockchain to protect against quantum computing threats.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Ensures long-term security for digital assets and transactions, but requires widespread adoption and standardization.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for standardization, compatibility with existing blockchain systems, and potential resistance from established blockchain platforms.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural-Enhanced Cognitive Augmentation
emerging_technologies.description: Development of neural interfaces that enhance human cognitive abilities through direct brain stimulation or augmentation.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises ethical issues around cognitive equity, potential for cognitive enhancement inequality, and privacy concerns regarding neural data.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Public perception, regulatory approval, long-term health effects, and the development of non-invasive or minimally invasive methods.

emerging_technologies.name: Multi-Planetary Resource Management
emerging_technologies.description: Systems for managing resources on extraterrestrial bodies like the Moon or Mars, including mining, transport, and distribution.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for new economies and conflicts over extraterrestrial resources, requiring new legal frameworks and international cooperation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological feasibility, economic viability, international agreements, and the establishment of sustainable off-world colonies.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Enhanced Personal Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: AI assistants that can perform complex tasks, predict user needs, and integrate seamlessly into daily life.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in consumer devices, enterprise solutions, and smart home systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Transport
mainstream_technologies.description: Fully autonomous vehicles for urban transport, reducing traffic congestion and improving safety.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Integration into public transport systems, private ride-sharing services, and logistics.

epoch_themes.description: A focus on technologies that enhance human capabilities through direct interaction with machines, leading to cognitive and physical augmentation.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Redefines the boundaries of human potential, raises ethical questions about augmentation, privacy, and the nature of human identity.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing investment in neural tech, cognitive enhancement, and ethical AI development.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies that support the expansion of human presence beyond Earth while ensuring sustainability on our home planet.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes a new era of space colonization, environmental stewardship, and resource management, potentially altering global economic dynamics.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growing emphasis on sustainable practices, renewable energy, and the commercialization of space.
